page.title: 08SHOPPING IN HORLEY
page.content: Several people were interviewed in {Horley Town Centre.}About 30% were from neighbouring towns and London. Most worked locally. People approved of the town centre's location and the layout but wanted more department stores,for more variety,specially in childrens clothing and toys.Many felt that Woolworths should re-open. Some complained about the pavements.The popular shops were - Waitrose for its wide selection of foodstuff, Shoppers Paradise for low prices and Collingwood Batchelors for traditional and quality items. All three chemists were popular,Cross and Herberts was the oldest;Boots was favoured for its prices;Savoury & Moore which had recently opened was modern with a wide selection.People felt there were too many Building Societies and banks.
